snippet.title: Police reveal two plots planned by Sydney terror suspects
snippet.content: An Islamic State commander sent components to Sydney to build an improvised explosive device that was to be taken on an Etihad flight, police allege. Details of the Sydeny-based terror plot, that was foiled by police on Saturday, have been revealed including the aborted plan to take the IED on the flight on July 15.Photo: DEAN LEWINS A second plot related to the building of an improvised chemical dispersion device to release colourless toxic gas. "This is one of the most sophisticated plots that has ever been attempted on Australian soil," Australian Federal Police Deputy Commissioner Michael Phelan said on Friday. On Thursday night, the Mahmoud Khayat, 32, and Khaled Mahmoud Khayat, 49, each with two counts of acting in preparation for or planning a terrorist act. Both men are scheduled to appear in Parramatta Court on Friday morning. The maximum penalty each could face is life imprisonment. MORE TO COME

sindex.name: Australian Federal Police Deputy Commissioner Michael Phelan
